qas.question: Where is the National Training Center located?
Where is the Joint Readiness Training Center located?
Where is the Joint Multinational Training Center located?
In what year was ARFORGEN approved?
In what states is Fort Bliss located?
Where is the International Training Center located?
Where is the Double Readiness Training Center located?
Where is the Joint International Training Center located?
In what cities is Fort Bliss located?

context: Collective training at the unit level takes place at the unit's assigned station, but the most intensive training at higher echelons is conducted at the three combat training centers (CTC); the National Training Center (NTC) at <a0_0><b5_0>Fort Irwin, California<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the Joint Readiness Training Center (JRTC) at <a1_0><b6_0>Fort Polk, Louisiana<b6_0/><a1_0/>, and the Joint Multinational Training Center (JMRC) at the Hohenfels Training Area in <a2_0><b7_0>Hohenfels, Germany<b7_0/><a2_0/>. ARFORGEN is the Army Force Generation process approved in <a3_0><b8_0>2006<b8_0/><a3_0/> to meet the need to continuously replenish forces for deployment, at unit level, and for other echelons as required by the mission. Individual-level replenishment still requires training at a unit level, which is conducted at the continental US (CONUS) replacement center at Fort Bliss, in <a4_0><b9_0>New Mexico and Texas<b9_0/><a4_0/>, before their individual deployment.
